briefdescription.para: Returns a vector of ancestors of the given snapshot.

parameterdescription.para: The snapshot ID to start from

simplesect.para: A vector of ancestor snapshots

memberdef.argsstring: (int64_t snapshot_id, const std::function< Result< std::shared_ptr< Snapshot > >(int64_t)> &lookup)
memberdef.name: AncestorsOf

briefdescription.para: Returns a vector of ancestors of the given snapshot.

parameterdescription.para: The snapshot ID to start from
A function to look up snapshots by ID

simplesect.para: A vector of ancestor snapshots

briefdescription.para: Returns whether ancestor_snapshot_id is an ancestor of snapshot_id.

parameterdescription.para: The ancestor snapshot ID to check for

simplesect.para: true if ancestor_snapshot_id is an ancestor of snapshot_id

memberdef.argsstring: (int64_t snapshot_id, int64_t ancestor_snapshot_id, const std::function< Result< std::shared_ptr< Snapshot > >(int64_t)> &lookup)
memberdef.name: IsAncestorOf

briefdescription.para: Returns whether ancestor_snapshot_id is an ancestor of snapshot_id using the given lookup function.

parameterdescription.para: The ancestor snapshot ID to check for
Function to lookup snapshots by ID

simplesect.para: true if ancestor_snapshot_id is an ancestor of snapshot_id

briefdescription.para: Returns whether ancestor_snapshot_id is an ancestor of the table's current state.

parameterdescription.para: The ancestor snapshot ID to check for

simplesect.para: true if ancestor_snapshot_id is an ancestor of the current snapshot

briefdescription.para: Returns whether ancestor_snapshot_id is an ancestor of the metadata's current state.

parameterdescription.para: The ancestor snapshot ID to check for

simplesect.para: true if ancestor_snapshot_id is an ancestor of the current snapshot

briefdescription.para: Returns whether some ancestor of snapshot_id has parentId matches ancestor_parent_snapshot_id.

parameterdescription.para: The ancestor parent snapshot ID to check for

simplesect.para: true if any ancestor has the given parent ID

briefdescription.para: Returns a vector that traverses the table's snapshots from the current to the last known ancestor.

simplesect.para: A vector from the table's current snapshot to its last known ancestor

briefdescription.para: Returns a vector that traverses the metadata's snapshots from the current to the last known ancestor.

simplesect.para: A vector from the metadata's current snapshot to its last known ancestor

briefdescription.para: Returns the snapshot IDs for the ancestors of the current table state.

detaileddescription.para: Ancestor IDs are ordered by commit time, descending. The first ID is the current snapshot, followed by its parent, and so on.

simplesect.para: A vector of snapshot IDs of the known ancestor snapshots, including the current ID

briefdescription.para: Traverses the history of the table's current snapshot and finds the oldest Snapshot.

simplesect.para: The oldest snapshot, or nullopt if there is no current snapshot

briefdescription.para: Traverses the history and finds the oldest ancestor of the specified snapshot.

detaileddescription.para: Oldest ancestor is defined as the ancestor snapshot whose parent is null or has been expired. If the specified snapshot has no parent or parent has been expired, the specified snapshot itself is returned.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the snapshot to find the oldest ancestor

simplesect.para: The oldest snapshot, or nullopt if not found

briefdescription.para: Traverses the history of the table's current snapshot, finds the oldest snapshot that was committed either at or after a given time.

simplesect.para: The first snapshot after the given timestamp, or nullopt if the current snapshot is older than the timestamp. If the first ancestor after the given time can't be determined, returns a NotFound error.

briefdescription.para: Returns list of snapshot ids in the range (from_snapshot_id,to_snapshot_id].

detaileddescription.para: This method assumes that from_snapshot_id is an ancestor of to_snapshot_id.

simplesect.para: A vector of snapshot IDs in the range

memberdef.argsstring: (const Table &table, int64_t latest_snapshot_id, const std::optional< int64_t > &oldest_snapshot_id)
memberdef.name: AncestorIdsBetween

briefdescription.para: Returns a vector of ancestor IDs between two snapshots.

parameterdescription.para: The oldest snapshot ID (optional, nullopt means all ancestors)

simplesect.para: A vector of snapshot IDs between the two snapshots

memberdef.argsstring: (const Table &table, int64_t latest_snapshot_id, std::optional< int64_t > oldest_snapshot_id)
memberdef.name: AncestorsBetween

briefdescription.para: Returns a vector of ancestors between two snapshots.

parameterdescription.para: The oldest snapshot ID (optional, nullopt means all ancestors)

simplesect.para: A vector of ancestor snapshots between the two snapshots

briefdescription.para: Traverses the history of the table's current snapshot and finds the snapshot with the given snapshot id as its parent.

simplesect.para: The snapshot for which the given snapshot is the parent

briefdescription.para: Returns the ID of the most recent snapshot for the table as of the timestamp.

parameterdescription.para: The timestamp in millis since the Unix epoch

simplesect.para: The snapshot ID

briefdescription.para: Returns the ID of the most recent snapshot for the table as of the timestamp.

parameterdescription.para: The timestamp in millis since the Unix epoch

simplesect.para: The snapshot ID

briefdescription.para: Returns the ID of the most recent snapshot for the table as of the timestamp, or nullopt if not found.

parameterdescription.para: The timestamp in millis since the Unix epoch

simplesect.para: The snapshot ID, or nullopt if not found

briefdescription.para: Returns the schema of the table for the specified snapshot.

simplesect.para: The schema

briefdescription.para: Returns the schema of the table for the specified timestamp.

parameterdescription.para: The timestamp in millis since the Unix epoch

simplesect.para: The schema

briefdescription.para: Return the schema of the snapshot at a given ref.

detaileddescription.para: If the ref does not exist or the ref is a branch, the table schema is returned because it will be the schema when the new branch is created. If the ref is a tag, then the snapshot schema is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Ref name of the table (empty string means main branch)

simplesect.para: Schema of the specific snapshot at the given ref

briefdescription.para: Return the schema of the snapshot at a given ref.

detaileddescription.para: If the ref does not exist or the ref is a branch, the table schema is returned because it will be the schema when the new branch is created. If the ref is a tag, then the snapshot schema is returned.

parameterdescription.para: Ref name of the table (empty string means main branch)

simplesect.para: Schema of the specific snapshot at the given branch

briefdescription.para: Fetch the snapshot at the head of the given branch in the given table.

detaileddescription.para: This method calls TableMetadata::Snapshot() instead of using branch API for the main branch so that existing code still goes through the old code path to ensure backwards compatibility.

parameterdescription.para: Branch name of the table (empty string means main branch)

simplesect.para: The latest snapshot for the given branch, or NotFoundError.

briefdescription.para: Fetch the snapshot at the head of the given branch in the given table.

detaileddescription.para: This method calls TableMetadata::Snapshot() instead of using branch API for the main branch so that existing code still goes through the old code path to ensure backwards compatibility.
If branch does not exist, the table's latest snapshot is returned it will be the schema when the new branch is created.

parameterdescription.para: Branch name of the table metadata (empty string means main branch)

simplesect.para: The latest snapshot for the given branch, or NotFoundError.

briefdescription.para: Fetch the snapshot at the head of the given branch in the given table.

detaileddescription.para: Like LatestSnapshot above except that nullptr is returned if snapshot does not exist.

parameterdescription.para: Branch name of the table metadata (empty string means main branch)

simplesect.para: The latest snapshot for the given branch, or nullptr if not found.

briefdescription.para: Generate a new snapshot ID.
Generate a new snapshot ID for the given metadata.

simplesect.para: A new snapshot ID

briefdescription.para: Helper function to traverse ancestors of a snapshot.

simplesect.para: A vector of ancestor snapshots

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::shared_ptr< Snapshot > &snapshot, const std::function< Result< std::shared_ptr< Snapshot > >(int64_t)> &lookup)
memberdef.name: AncestorsOf

briefdescription.para: Helper function to traverse ancestors of a snapshot using a lookup function.

parameterdescription.para: Function to lookup snapshots by ID

simplesect.para: A vector of ancestor snapshots

briefdescription.para: Helper function to convert snapshots to IDs.

simplesect.para: A vector of snapshot IDs

briefdescription.para: Utility functions for working with snapshots.

simplesect.para: All the returned std::shared_ptr<Snapshot> are guaranteed to be not null.
